parts.text:
```xml
<output>
<analysis>
<has-cmf>The post includes a CMF number (CMF 11240015) at the end. This strongly suggests it is electoral propaganda, as CMF numbers are used for tracking and reporting campaign spending.</has-cmf>
<refers-to-candidate>The post explicitly refers to the USR party ("Votați echipa USR").  While it doesn't name specific candidates, it clearly promotes a political party participating in the parliamentary elections. This fulfills "Article 36 (7) - a".</refers-to-candidate>
<addresses-the-wide-population>As a paid Facebook post, this message is clearly intended to reach a wide audience, not just a select few.  The use of Facebook as a platform further supports this.</addresses-the-wide-population>
<electoral-objective>The post's primary objective is to encourage voters to support the USR party in the parliamentary elections. Phrases like "Hai la vot!", "Votați echipa USR", and the warning about potential negative consequences of voting for other parties ("Un Parlament cu extremişti sau pro-ruşi...") directly aim to influence voting behavior. This satisfies "Article 36 (7) - c".</electoral-objective>
<journalism>The post does not present itself as journalistic. It lacks objective reporting and instead uses persuasive language and appeals to emotion to advocate for a specific political party.  It's clearly an opinion piece designed to sway voters, not inform them objectively.</journalism>
<personal_opinion>The content is not a personal opinion; it's a clearly partisan political message promoting a specific party's platform and urging voters to support them. The language used is not neutral or objective.</personal_opinion>
</analysis>

<conclusion>
<post_id>1279326216711414</post_id>
<electoral-propaganda-analysis>
The post fulfills all the criteria for electoral propaganda as defined by Article 36 (7) of LEGE nr. 334 din 17 iulie 2006. It refers to a specific political party (USR), targets a wide audience through a paid Facebook advertisement, has a clear electoral objective (influencing votes for USR), and uses persuasive language rather than objective journalism. The presence of a CMF number further strengthens this conclusion.  The post's timing (after the official campaign period) is also a significant factor.  While the exact end date of the campaign is not specified, the context suggests it's likely a violation if the campaign period has ended.
</electoral-propaganda-analysis>
<electoral-propaganda-decision>TRUE</electoral-propaganda-decision>
<electoral-propaganda-candidates>
  <candidate><name>USR</name><impact>POSITIVE</impact></candidate>
</electoral-propaganda-candidates>
<responsible-party-or-group>USR</responsible-party-or-group>
<message-for-police>
[Brian Cristian], pentru încălcarea articolului 98 t) din LEGEA nr. 208 din 20 iulie 2015, prin publicarea unei postări pe Facebook după ora 18:00 pe 23.11.2024, cu ID-ul 1279326216711414, care promovează USR prin mesaje persuasive precum "Hai la vot!", "Votați echipa USR" și avertismente despre consecințele votării altor partide, având un efect electoral clar de influențare a voturilor în favoarea USR. Postarea, care a costat între 1000 și 1500 RON, a avut o acoperire de 15.000-20.000 de impresii, conform datelor din Ad Library, și a vizat utilizatorii din județul Maramureș, cu vârste între 18 și 65 de ani.  Prezența numărului CMF 11240015 confirmă natura electorală a postării, demonstrând intenția de a influența votul în favoarea USR, în clară încălcare a prevederilor legale privind perioada de campanie electorală.  Contact: maramures@usrmm.ro, +40751926939.
</message-for-police>
</conclusion>
</output>
```
